title: Bank of Mexico Raises Interest Rates in Split Decision
sub_head: Bank now expects inflation to return to 3% target in the third quarter of 2022
body:
The Bank of Mexico raised interest rates Thursday in a surprise decision after inflation came in higher than expected in the first half of June.
The board of governors voted 3-2 in favor of lifting the overnight interest-rate target by a quarter percentage point to 4.25%, the first increase since December 2018. Two of the five board members voted to keep the rate at 4%.
